# This is the Answer sheet for CS762 Assignment 1. Source Code in assign1InfoG.ipynb
    the source code is organised as follows:
    Block 1 includes all the functions that calculate the entropy and information gains.
    Block 2 defines the decision tree Structure including Tree Class and Node Class.
    Block 3 defines the functions to operate datasets, like clean date, split data etc..
    Block 4 includes functions to get hypo_parameters, in this assignment that is depth of the tree. and T test function to compare the three models.
    Block 5 operates to deal with the BCP.csv dataset
    Block 6 operates to deal with the website-phishing.csv dataset
    Block 7 operates to deal with the arrhythmia.csv dataset
 
# Answer1: Data_clean for Datasets 
##   using clean_data function to Clean my datasets. 
    1. For Every Dataset, replace values '?' to np.nan(NULL) because the Null value is easier to deal with.
    2. Drop Columns if the Columns include more than 70% of nan values.
    3. Trim the Columns' names if there are spaces pre- or post of columns' names.
    4. Convert String Value to number by columns.
    5. Fill Null Values with mean of the column.
    6. Drop the column if the values are all the same in this column.
    7. Drop duplicate rows.
## using drop_controversy_observation to clean controversy rows in dataset
    drop controversy row in Dataset. Those rows have all the same values in attributes but get different targets.

# Answer2:
    Split dataset into 80% as train dataset to create model, 20% as test dataset.
    Using Entropy and Information Gain to select the attribute and threshold to create a node.
    1. sort distinct value of the attribute
    2. create thredhold array 
       thresholdArray.append((uniValArray[i]+ uniValArray[i+1])/2)
       
    3. for each thredhold in thredholdArray,split dataset, get the weight of each subset in whole set.
    
        subSet1Cnt = subSet1[eCol].count()
        pSubSet1 = subSet1Cnt/recordsNum
        
        subSet2Cnt = subSet2[eCol].count()
        pSubSet2 = subSet2Cnt/recordsNum

     
    4. In each SubSet,get probabilities p for each value(result) in targetClass.
        groupByClassSet1 = subSet1.groupby(targetClass)
        probClassInSet1Group = groupByClassSet1[targetClass].count()/subSet1Cnt   

    5. count the subset Entropy using formular:
         H(X) = - Σ P(x_i) * log2(P(x_i))
          
        eInSet1Group -= p*np.log2(p)

        eInSet2Group -= p*np.log2(p)
    6. count the weighted entropy for the attribute
        e = pSubSet1*eInSet1Group + pSubSet2*eInSet2Group

    7. for every thredhold in Array,continue steps from 3,get an entropy array.

    8. select min entropy for this attribute as the entropy Ei for attribute i.
        
    9. calc the entropy for targetClass with the entropy formular as normal.in function calc_class_entropy
            targetEntropy = -np.sum(probalities * (np.log2(probalities)))

    10. calc the information gain for the attribute
            information gain= targetEntropy - Ei

    11. repeat steps from 1~10 to get the max information gain list of all attributes.

    12. select the attribute and threshold with max information gain in  the list. use this attribute to create node.

### The Pruned Tree

# Answer3:
## use post pruning technical to prune the tree. 
    1. create the full tree first.
    2. get the depth as D of full tree.
    3. split original training dataset(trainData) into trainingData and validationData. training 70% to traning the model, and 30% to validate the model.
        trainingData,validationData = split_dataset(trainData,percentage=0.7,random = 16)
    4. create model at depth 1 to D with traning data. 
    5. verify every model with validate data set.
    6. choose the D as hypo_parameter with the min test error rate.
    7. train a Pruned Tree at depth of the hypo_parameter with the original training dataset(trainData)
    8. test the Pruned Tree with testData
